publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-4860 Jamie Hepburn: Ravenswood Bog and Meadow Nature Reserve—That the Parliament celebrates the launch on 24 September 2009 of Ravenswood Bog and Meadow Nature Reserve in Cumbernauld, a project that is the culmination of a successful partnership between Greenspace Services of North Lanarkshire Council, the Scottish Training Foundation and the local community; notes that the project has transformed a large and inaccessible area of open waste land between the A80 and A73 to an all-weather surfaced path network that includes a timber boardwalk and the creation of new wildlife ponds, gardens and orchid meadow areas, and also notes that the project has provided 40 training opportunities for local people to develop new skills and gain essential work experience.

S3M-4860 Ravenswood Bog and Meadow Nature Reserve (lodged on 15 September 2009) Kenneth Gibson*, Robin Harper*, Bob Doris*, Rob Gibson*, Aileen Campbell*, Alasdair Allan*, Bill Kidd*, Stuart McMillan*, Gil Paterson*

S3M-4860 Jamie Hepburn: Ravenswood Bog and Meadow Nature Reserve—That the Parliament celebrates the launch on 24 September 2009 of Ravenswood Bog and Meadow Nature Reserve in Cumbernauld, a project that is the culmination of a successful partnership between Greenspace Services of North Lanarkshire Council, the Scottish Training Foundation and the local community; notes that the project has transformed a large and inaccessible area of open waste land between the A80 and A73 to an all-weather surfaced path network that includes a timber boardwalk and the creation of new wildlife ponds, gardens and orchid meadow areas, and also notes that the project has provided 40 training opportunities for local people to develop new skills and gain essential work experience. Supported by: Kenneth Gibson, Robin Harper, Bob Doris, Rob Gibson, Aileen Campbell, Alasdair Allan, Bill Kidd, Stuart McMillan, Gil Paterson, Michael Matheson*
